page.title: 05LIFE STYLES IN WEMBDON
page.content: { Few people work in Wembdon, most work in Bridgwater or at the nearby Hinkley Point nuclear power station. In the village there is a post office with a small general store, a small grocer's shop and an inn. A builder, an antique furniture restorer and a car mechanic work in the village. An old people's home has 13 residents and 2 staff. The population of Wembdon is 1750 and there is an infant school and a junior school for the children. The infant school has 102 pupils and the junior school 130. Guides, brownies, scouts, cubs and a junior cycling club cater for the children. About 250 people worship in the Norman village church and many social and fund raising activities are centred around it
